text: Romeo Cormier (5 January 1950 â€“ 17 January 2020) was a Canadian professional wrestler. He was best known by the ring name Bobby Kay. He was a member of the Cormier wrestling family, a group of four brothers who were all successful professional wrestlers. He worked in Canada and the United States from 1967 to the mid-1980s. He owned and operated part of the Eastern Sports Association. After retiring from wrestling, he performed country music professionally before taking a job with Loblaws. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Canadian professional wrestlers Category:Sportspeople from Moncton
title: Bobby Kay
